I.translation[0].definitions[0].definiti: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself
I.translation[0].definitions[0].example[: I moved to this city six years ago.
I’m not late again, am I?
My husband and I enjoy going to the theatre.
I.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with I
I.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0].ex: Sarah and I went for coffee
I.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1].ex: In everyday English, you say that someone is older, younger, taller etc than me
I.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2].ex: They were older than I was
I.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3].ex: It sounds very formal to say than I
I.translation[1].definitions[0].definiti: the ninth letter of the English alphabet
I.translation[1].definitions[1].definiti: the number one in the system of roman numerals
I.translation[2].definitions[0].definiti: used in the names of some products or services that involve using the Internet
I.translation[2].definitions[0].example[: iTunes (=trademark for a service allowing you to buy music over the Internet)
I.translation[3].definitions[0].definiti: a person from a particular country or place, or their language
I.translation[3].definitions[1].definiti: of a particular place or country
